references.reason: This paper provides a benchmark dataset for structured prediction tasks, which is directly used for evaluating the proposed algorithm.

references.paper_title: Grammar-constrained decoding for structured NLP tasks without finetuning
references.reason: This paper introduces a baseline grammar-constrained decoding algorithm (GCD) that is compared against the novel algorithm proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Monitor-guided decoding of code LLMs with static analysis of repository context
references.reason: This paper is relevant as it addresses a similar problem of generating structured code using large language models, offering a related approach to constrained decoding.
This paper proposes a novel sampling technique that could be adapted to the proposed algorithm, offering potential improvements in efficiency and sampling quality.

references.paper_title: Synchromesh: Reliable code generation from pre-trained language models
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it focuses on the problem of reliable code generation using pre-trained language models, a topic directly addressed in this paper.
